segment.source: Customize the print preview UI
segment.target: Customize the print preview UI

segment.source: This section describes how to customize the print options and settings in the print preview UI.
segment.target: This section describes how to customize the print options and settings in the print preview UI.

segment.source: Customize the print preview UI
segment.target: Customize the print preview UI

segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: Windows.Graphics.Printing
segment.target: Windows.Graphics.Printing

segment.source: Windows.UI.Xaml.Printing
segment.target: Windows.UI.Xaml.Printing

segment.source: PrintManager
segment.target: PrintManager

segment.source: This section describes how to customize the print options and settings in the print preview UI.
segment.target: This section describes how to customize the print options and settings in the print preview UI.

segment.source: For more info about printing, see Print from your app.
segment.target: For more info about printing, see Print from your app.

segment.source: Tip Most of the examples in this topic are based on the print sample.
segment.target: Tip Most of the examples in this topic are based on the print sample.

segment.source: To see the full code, download the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) print sample from the Windows-universal-samples repo on GitHub.
segment.target: To see the full code, download the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) print sample from the Windows-universal-samples repo on GitHub.

segment.source: Customize print options
segment.target: Customize print options

segment.source: By default, the print preview UI shows the ColorMode, Copies, and Orientation print options.
segment.target: By default, the print preview UI shows the ColorMode, Copies, and Orientation print options.

segment.source: In addition to those, there are several other common printer options that you can add to the print preview UI:
segment.target: In addition to those, there are several other common printer options that you can add to the print preview UI:

segment.source: Binding
segment.target: Binding

segment.source: Collation
segment.target: Collation

segment.source: Duplex
segment.target: Duplex

segment.source: HolePunch
segment.target: HolePunch

segment.source: InputBin
segment.target: InputBin

segment.source: MediaSize
segment.target: MediaSize

segment.source: MediaType
segment.target: MediaType

segment.source: NUp
segment.target: NUp

segment.source: PrintQuality
segment.target: PrintQuality

segment.source: Staple
segment.target: Staple

segment.source: These options are defined in the StandardPrintTaskOptions class.
segment.target: These options are defined in the StandardPrintTaskOptions class.

segment.source: You can add to or remove options from the list of options displayed in the print preview UI.
segment.target: You can add to or remove options from the list of options displayed in the print preview UI.

segment.source: You can also change the order in which they appear, and set the default settings that are shown to the user.
segment.target: You can also change the order in which they appear, and set the default settings that are shown to the user.

segment.source: However, the modifications that you make by using this method affect only the print preview UI.
segment.target: However, the modifications that you make by using this method affect only the print preview UI.

segment.source: The user can always access all of the options that the printer supports by tapping More settings in the print preview UI.
segment.target: The user can always access all of the options that the printer supports by tapping More settings in the print preview UI.

segment.source: Note Although your app can specify any print options to be displayed, only those that are supported by the selected printer are shown in the print preview UI.
segment.target: Note Although your app can specify any print options to be displayed, only those that are supported by the selected printer are shown in the print preview UI.

segment.source: The print UI won't show options that the selected printer doesn't support.
segment.target: The print UI won't show options that the selected printer doesn't support.

segment.source: Define the options to display
segment.target: Define the options to display

segment.source: When the app's screen is loaded, it registers for the Print contract.
segment.target: When the app's screen is loaded, it registers for the Print contract.

segment.source: Part of that registration includes defining the PrintTaskRequested event handler.
segment.target: Part of that registration includes defining the PrintTaskRequested event handler.

segment.source: The code to customize the options displayed in the print preview UI is added to the PrintTaskRequested event handler.
segment.target: The code to customize the options displayed in the print preview UI is added to the PrintTaskRequested event handler.

segment.source: Modify the PrintTaskRequested event handler to include the printTask.options instructions that configure the print settings that you want to display in the print preview UI.For the screen in your app for which you want to show a customized list of print options, override the PrintTaskRequested event handler in the helper class to include code that specifies the options to display when the screen is printed.
segment.target: Modify the PrintTaskRequested event handler to include the printTask.options instructions that configure the print settings that you want to display in the print preview UI.For the screen in your app for which you want to show a customized list of print options, override the PrintTaskRequested event handler in the helper class to include code that specifies the options to display when the screen is printed.

segment.source: Important Calling displayedOptions.clear() removes all of the print options from the print preview UI, including the More settings link.
segment.target: Important Calling displayedOptions.clear() removes all of the print options from the print preview UI, including the More settings link.

segment.source: Be sure to append the options that you want to show on the print preview UI.
segment.target: Be sure to append the options that you want to show on the print preview UI.

segment.source: Specify default options
segment.target: Specify default options

segment.source: You can also set the default values of the options in the print preview UI.
segment.target: You can also set the default values of the options in the print preview UI.

segment.source: The following line of code, from the last example, sets the default value of the MediaSize option.
segment.target: The following line of code, from the last example, sets the default value of the MediaSize option.

segment.source: Add new print options
segment.target: Add new print options

segment.source: This section shows how to create a new print option, define a list of values that the option supports, and then add the option to the print preview.
segment.target: This section shows how to create a new print option, define a list of values that the option supports, and then add the option to the print preview.

segment.source: As in the previous section, add the new print option in the PrintTaskRequested event handler.
segment.target: As in the previous section, add the new print option in the PrintTaskRequested event handler.

segment.source: First, get a PrintTaskOptionDetails object.
segment.target: First, get a PrintTaskOptionDetails object.

segment.source: This is used to add the new print option to the print preview UI.
segment.target: This is used to add the new print option to the print preview UI.

segment.source: Then clear the list of options that are shown in the print preview UI and add the options that you want to display when the user wants to print from the app.
segment.target: Then clear the list of options that are shown in the print preview UI and add the options that you want to display when the user wants to print from the app.

segment.source: After that, create the new print option and initialize the list of option values.
segment.target: After that, create the new print option and initialize the list of option values.

segment.source: Finally, add the new option and assign a handler for the OptionChanged event.
segment.target: Finally, add the new option and assign a handler for the OptionChanged event.

segment.source: The options appear in the print preview UI in the same order they are appended, with the first option shown at the top of the window.
segment.target: The options appear in the print preview UI in the same order they are appended, with the first option shown at the top of the window.

segment.source: In this example, the custom option is appended last so that it appears at the bottom of the list of options.
segment.target: In this example, the custom option is appended last so that it appears at the bottom of the list of options.

segment.source: However, you could put it anywhere in the list; custom print options don't need to be added last.
segment.target: However, you could put it anywhere in the list; custom print options don't need to be added last.

segment.source: When the user changes the selected option in your custom option, update the print preview image.
segment.target: When the user changes the selected option in your custom option, update the print preview image.

segment.source: Call the InvalidatePreview method to redraw the image in the print preview UI, as shown below.
segment.target: Call the InvalidatePreview method to redraw the image in the print preview UI, as shown below.
